redflags.title: Red Flags & Safety Screening
redflags.subtitle: Contraindications & Emergency Referrals
redflags.intro: These conditions require immediate medical referral. Do not treat until cleared.
osteo_principles: Do No Harm: Always screen VBI before C-spine manipulation.
Cauda Equina: A surgical emergency. Time is function.
Fractures: Use validated rules (Ottawa) to reduce unnecessary X-rays.

pathologies.name: Cauda Equina Syndrome
pathologies.mechanics: Compression of distal nerve roots (L1-S5).

neuro: Document: Time of onset and neurological status.

pathologies.patient_advice: This is a medical emergency. You must go to the Emergency Room immediately to prevent permanent bladder or bowel paralysis.

pathologies.name: Cervical Instability / VBI
pathologies.mechanics: Alar/Transverse ligament rupture or Vertebrobasilar Insufficiency.
special_tests: Alar Ligament Test: Side bend C2 stabilization.

manual: Avoid: High Velocity Thrusts (HVT) or End-range rotation.

pathologies.patient_advice: We need to avoid aggressive movements of your neck today to ensure the safety of the blood vessels and ligaments supporting your head.

pathologies.name: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
pathologies.mechanics: Clot in deep vein. Risk of Pulmonary Embolism.
pathologies.patient_advice: The swelling and warmth in your leg needs to be checked by a doctor to rule out a clot before we can continue therapy.

pediatrics.title: Pediatric Conditions
pediatrics.subtitle: Growth Plate & Developmental Issues
pediatrics.intro: Children are not mini-adults. Pain is often related to growth spurts (apophysitis).
osteo_principles: Growth Plates: The weakest link in the chain (weaker than ligament).
Flexibility vs Strength: Bones grow faster than muscles stretch.
Scoliosis: Screen during growth spurts (ages 10-14).

pathologies.name: Osgood-Schlatter / Sinding-Larsen
pathologies.mechanics: Traction apophysitis of Extensor mechanism due to tight Quads.
pathologies.patient_advice: This is 'growing pains' caused by the muscle pulling on the bone. Ice it after sports, and we will stretch the thigh muscles to reduce the tension.

pathologies.name: Sever's Disease (Calcaneal Apophysitis)
pathologies.mechanics: Achilles pulling on calcaneal growth plate.
pathologies.patient_advice: Your heel bone is irritated by the tight calf muscle. A heel cup in your shoe and calf stretches will help it heal.

pathologies.name: Scoliosis Screening
pathologies.mechanics: Lateral curvature + Rotation of vertebrae.
special_tests: Adam's Forward Bend Test: Look for rib hump.
pathologies.patient_advice: We are monitoring the curve in your spine. Specialized exercises can help strengthen the muscles to support your posture.

geriatrics.title: Geriatric Conditions
geriatrics.subtitle: Degenerative & Balance Issues
geriatrics.intro: Focus on function, fall prevention, and managing degenerative changes.
osteo_principles: Bone Density: Gentle techniques for Osteoporosis.
Circulation: Check distal pulses.
Stiffness: Mobilize to maintain function, not necessarily 'perfect' alignment.

pathologies.name: Falls Risk / Balance
pathologies.mechanics: Sensory decline (vision, vestibular, prop).

manual: Ankle Mobilization: Restore DF for balance strategies.
neuro: Proprioception: Tai Chi / Single leg stand support.

pathologies.patient_advice: Improving your balance and leg strength is the best way to prevent falls and keep you independent at home.

pathologies.name: Osteoporosis / Compression Fracture
pathologies.mechanics: Bone fragility. Anterior wedge fractures.
pathologies.patient_advice: We need to focus on 'standing tall'. Avoid bending forward at the waist to pick things up; use your legs instead to protect your spine.

cervical.title: Cervical Spine
cervical.subtitle: Occipito-atlantal (C0-C1) to C7-T1
cervical.intro: Neck pain requires clearing the VBI (Vertebrobasilar Insufficiency) and Alar ligaments first. Upper cervical dysfunction is a key driver of headaches.
osteo_principles: Suboccipital Triangle: C1/C2 rotation is crucial (50% of all neck rotation). Dysfunction here causes tension headaches.
Sympathetic Ganglia: Superior Cervical Ganglion affects eyes/ears/balance.
Lower Cervical (C5-C7): Most common sites for disc herniation and radiculopathy.

pathologies.name: Cervical Radiculopathy
pathologies.mechanics: Nerve root compression (disc or osteophyte). Downstream paresthesia.
special_tests: Wainner's Cluster: 1. Spurlings A, 2. Distraction Test, 3. ULNT 1, 4. Rotation < 60°.

met: Upper Trapezius MET: Depress shoulder, side bend away.
neuro: Median/Radial/Ulnar Sliders: Gentle flossing, do not aggravate.

pathologies.patient_advice: The nerve coming from your neck is pinched, sending pain to your arm. We will use gentle traction to open the space and 'floss' the nerve to reduce irritation.

pathologies.name: Cervicogenic Headache
pathologies.mechanics: Convergence of C1-C3 afferents with Trigeminal nerve (Trigeminocervical nucleus).
special_tests: CFRT (Cervical Flexion Rotation Test): Gold standard for C1/C2 mobility.
Cranio-Cervical Flexion Test (CCFT): Deep neck flexor endurance.

neuro: Greater Occipital Nerve Mob: Soft tissue release at the nuchal line.

pathologies.patient_advice: Your headache is coming from the stiff joints at the top of your neck. Loosening these muscles and joints will stop the referral of pain to your head.

thoracic.title: Thoracic Spine
thoracic.subtitle: T1 to T12 & Rib Cage
thoracic.intro: The T-spine is the 'stiff' link. Mobilizing the thorax often solves neck and low back pain.
osteo_principles: Autonomic Nervous System: Sympathetic chain runs anterior to rib heads. T4 syndrome affects arm circulation.
Rib Mechanics: Pump handle (Upper) vs Bucket handle (Lower).
Regional Dependence: Poor T-spine extension leads to Shoulder Impingement.

pathologies.name: T4 Syndrome
pathologies.mechanics: Sympathetic outflow dysfunction causing 'glove-like' numbness or cold hands.
special_tests: T4 Palpation & PA Glide: Reproduces arm symptoms.
Slump Test: Often positive due to sympathetic tension.

met: Rib MET: Use respiration to correct inhalation/exhalation somatic dysfunction.

pathologies.patient_advice: Stiffness in your mid-back is irritating the nerves that control blood flow to your arms. Mobilizing the spine will restore normal circulation and sensation.

lumbar.title: Lumbar Spine
lumbar.subtitle: L1 to L5 & Sacrum
lumbar.intro: Load bearing. Screen for Red Flags (Cauda Equina) immediately.
osteo_principles: Fryette's Laws: Type 1 (Neutral) vs Type 2 (Non-Neutral) mechanics.
Psoas Connection: The psoas originates from T12-L5; tightness compresses the lumbar spine.
Pelvic Coupling: L5 moves opposite to the Sacrum.

pathologies.name: Lumbar Disc Herniation
pathologies.mechanics: Posterior-Lateral derangement. Directional Preference (usually Extension) is key.
special_tests: Crossed SLR: Highly specific for large herniation.

manual: Lumbar Rotation Mob: Grade III/IV for pain gating.
neuro: Sciatic Nerve Floss: Pump the ankle in slump position.

pathologies.patient_advice: The disc is bulging backwards. We will use backward bending exercises to gently push the fluid back to the center and relieve pressure on the nerve.

pathologies.name: Lumbar Stenosis
pathologies.mechanics: Narrowing of canal. Extension intolerant. 'Shopping Cart Sign' (relief in flexion).
special_tests: Bicycle Test: Differentiates Neurogenic vs Vascular claudication.
Kemp's Test (Quadrant): Extension + Rotation causes local/referred pain.

met: Hip Flexor Release: To allow neutral pelvis without lumbar extension.

pathologies.patient_advice: The space for your nerves is narrow. Bending forward opens this space. We will stretch your hips so you can stand straighter without pinching the back.

shoulder.title: Shoulder Complex
shoulder.subtitle: GH, AC, SC, ST Joints
shoulder.intro: The 'Stable Base'. Always rule out C-Spine (C4-C6) referral.
osteo_principles: Check T-spine Kyphosis.
Assess Thoracic Outlet.
Fascial continuity (Pecs/Neck).

pathologies.name: Subacromial Impingement / RC
pathologies.mechanics: Anterior humeral glide, Scapular dyskinesis.
pathologies.patient_advice: The tendon is getting pinched when you lift your arm. We need to 'set the shoulder blade' back and loosen the chest muscles to give the tendon more room to move.

pathologies.name: Frozen Shoulder (Adhesive Capsulitis)
pathologies.mechanics: Global restriction. Compensatory hiking.
pathologies.patient_advice: The shoulder capsule has become tight and sticky. We will perform gentle, rhythmic movements to gradually stretch the capsule and restore motion.

pathologies.name: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS)
pathologies.mechanics: Neurovascular compression at Scalenes, Rib 1, or Pec Minor.

manual: 1st Rib Depression: High velocity or oscillation.
met: Scalene MET: Lat flex away, rotate towards.

pathologies.patient_advice: Tight neck muscles are squeezing the nerves/blood vessels going to your arm. Stretching the neck and dropping the first rib will relieve the pressure.

elbow.title: Elbow Complex
elbow.subtitle: Humeroulnar/radial
elbow.intro: Victim of Shoulder/Wrist issues. Check C5-C7.
osteo_principles: Carrying Angle.
Interosseous Membrane.

pathologies.name: Lateral Epicondylalgia
pathologies.mechanics: Wrist extensor overuse. Radial head hypomobility.

manual: Radial Head Ant Glide: Correct posterior position.

pathologies.patient_advice: Overuse of the wrist muscles is pulling on the elbow. We will mobilize the elbow joint and strengthen the wrist muscles to handle the load.

pathologies.name: Cubital Tunnel Syndrome
pathologies.mechanics: Ulnar nerve entrapment/traction. Valgus instability.
pathologies.patient_advice: The 'funny bone' nerve is irritated. Avoid leaning on your elbow and keeping it bent for long periods. Gliding exercises will help the nerve move freely.

wrist.title: Wrist & Hand
wrist.subtitle: Carpal & Intrinsic
wrist.intro: End effector. Dysfunctions reflect C-spine or carpal subluxation.
osteo_principles: Carpal Rows (Lunate alignment).
Tunnel integrity.

pathologies.name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
pathologies.mechanics: Median nerve compression. Check Double Crush.
pathologies.patient_advice: The tunnel in your wrist is tight. We will stretch the ligament and mobilize the wrist bones to open up the tunnel and give the nerve more space.

pathologies.name: De Quervain's Tenosynovitis
pathologies.mechanics: Stenosing tenosynovitis. Repetitive ulnar deviation.
special_tests: Finkelstein's Test: Thumb in fist, ulnar deviate.

neuro: Radial Nerve Floss: Focus on superficial branch.

pathologies.patient_advice: The tendon sheath at the base of your thumb is inflamed. Resting the thumb and gentle gliding of the wrist bones will reduce the friction.

hip.title: Hip & Pelvis
hip.subtitle: Iliofemoral & SIJ
osteo_principles: Innominate Rotations (Ant/Post).
Sacral Torsion.
Psoas influence.

pathologies.name: FAI / Labral Pathology
pathologies.mechanics: CAM/Pincer. Anterior pelvic tilt exacerbates.
